event_name: Bon Voyage - Club Hopping // Club Festival at Belgisches Viertel & Kwartier Lat√§ng
lineup: Lineup will be announced soon...
information:
On Saturday, July 12, 2025, Bon Voyage invites you to an unforgettable night in Cologne! At Common Bon Voyage, you can purchase a ticket for a specific club in the Belgian Quarter or Kwartier Lat√§ng. This ticket guarantees you entry to the chosen club. Additionally, it allows access to all other participating clubs, provided there is space. Take the opportunity to explore various locations and enjoy a diverse musical journey from Techno and House to HipHop and Drum&Bass.

Experience the Pulsating Nightlife of Cologne on an Unforgettable Journey through the Belgian Quarter and Kwartier Lat√§ng!

Discover the vibrant nightlife of Cologne as you embark on a unique adventure through two of its most lively districts: the Belgian Quarter and Kwartier Lat√§ng.

Belgian Quarter: Situated between Rudolfplatz and Friesenplatz, this central scene and nightlife district is the heart of Cologne‚Äôs alternative culture. Amidst stylish old buildings, you‚Äôll find eclectic boutiques, art galleries, record stores, and quirky bars, making it a hotspot for night owls.

Kwartier Lat√§ng: This year, we are expanding our event to Kwartier Lat√§ng, an area renowned for its bustling nightlife centered around Z√ºlpicher and Luxemburger streets. Its proximity to the university attracts not only students but also party enthusiasts from all over Cologne. The numerous bars, clubs, and pubs offer a diverse array of musical and culinary experiences.

Musical Diversity: Bon Voyage offers a broad spectrum of music genres: from Techno and House to HipHop, Drum&Bass, Psytrance, and even Charts. This ensures a varied night with something for every taste. Join us as we turn night into day and dance through the best clubs and bars in the city. Bon Voyage provides you with an exceptional club-hopping experience that showcases the diverse facets of Cologne‚Äôs party scene.

Electric Rhythms is a DJ collective hailing from France, Germany, and the Netherlands. They invite their audience on a captivating journey through a sonic landscape that blends the futuristic allure of science-fiction-house-music with the delicate charm of floral electro sounds and the relentless drive of automated and progressive techno beats. This collective possesses a wealth of experience in the electronic music realm, and they exclusively utilize vinyl records to skillfully weave their danceable narrative throughout the night.

Prepare for an unforgettable experience as you check in with them at the legend Hotel Europa in Aachen. Put on your dancing shoes and immerse yourself in a night of energy and creativity, set against the backdrop of Aachen's vibrant bohemian enclave.

information:
Lineup:

GLXY (Shogun Audio | UK)
Kyrist (Kynetic Sound, Dark Mttr and Overview Music | UK)

Fr√§nzn
Shay B2B Annca
Smeerlapp B2B Molovv
Thrive B2B Gus B2B Moonaddict

Hosted by Benski

__________________________________

Can‚Äôt wait to dance with you again to great music and extraordinary guests making this the probably most exciting CLX to date!

Both of our guests from the UK (yes we‚Äôve got two!!!) are no newcomers to the scene. They have both gained some extra momentum recently through successful releases on top labels as well as appearances at some of the most exciting lineups of the summer.

While GLXY started creating a real buzz with their soul-drenched style of production, including amazing vocalists such as DRS and Solah, their recent productions have witnessed an interesting approach to the rather darker end of the spectrum which just enriches their quality output even more. They have been an integral part of Friction‚Äôs Label Shogun Audio since 2017 and have regularly delivered outstanding releases and mind bending sets across the globe for Shogun ever since. Besides that they have been gracing stages at the likes of Liquicity, Let It Roll and SUNANDBASS, upgrading lineups across Europe incl. Fabric, RSO, Ministry of Sound and many more as well having multiple appearences in North America and Australia.

Kyrist has undoubtedly justified her place at the forefront of the UK's Drum & Bass scene on multiple levels. Her rise to eminence as prolific dj, producer and label owner has been a result of talent, hard work and patience. Best known for her dark, bass driven punishing yet soulful sets she has been spreading vibes internationally, adding some extra pepper to events for Alix Perez's 1985 Music and Break's Symmetry Recordings and is no stranger to the big festival stages such as Let It Roll, Outlook, Boomtown & Hospitality On The Beach, Glastonbury and Tomorrowland. As producer she has launched her own imprint Kynetic Sound in 2021 following from stand-out releases on Dispatch, Critical, and Hospital cementing her place in the scene even more.

This amazing Lineup will be rounded off by Fr√§nzn who delivered an extraordinary set at the Fete de la Musique this summer for us as well as our good friends Gus and our ‚ÄòBirthday Boy‚Äô Thrive and the CLX gang.

Last but not least, we want to tell you how much we missed dancing with you! We hope you had a lovely summer with your besties and can‚Äôt wait to show you great music and celebrate the club season with you and our amazing guests.

__________________________________

CLX = Striving to create a place for everyone to fully enjoy sophisticated and raw Drum and Bass. Cherishing the past while creating the future. Junglists, newcomers, uptempo fans and ravers are welcome.

information:
DJ HELL
Helmut Josef Geier alias DJ Hell ist eine Institution in der deutschen DJ-Szene. Der urspr√ºnglich gelernte Betriebsschlosser hat die Techno- und House-Szene gepr√§gt wie kein Zweiter. Als Resident-DJ in den renommiertesten M√ºnchner Techno-Klubs lie√ü er seit Mitte der 80er - nur unterbrochen durch Stippvisiten in Berlin und New York - die Puppen tanzen. Selbst in Hugh Heffners ber√ºhmter Playboy-Villa gab er ein Gastspiel. Der geb√ºrtige Altenmarkter und im Jahr 2003 vom GQ-Magazin gek√ºrte "Man of the Year" in der Kategorie Musik kultiviert au√üerdem seine hohe Design- und Modeaffinit√§t. Er designte ein Zimmer im M√ºnchner Flushing Meadow Hotel und produzierte die Musik f√ºr Modenschauen von Hugo Boss & Donatella Versace.

GREGOR TRESHER
Die Karriere von Gregor Tresher begann in den Neunziger Jahren in Frankfurt. Der Durchbruch gelang ihm Mitte der Zweitausender mit √úberhits, wie ‚ÄûA Thousand Nights‚Äú, die heute den Status ‚ÄûAll-Time-Classic‚Äú genie√üen. Seine Releases erschienen √ºber die Jahre auf solch illustren Labels, wie Cocoon, Ovum, Drumcode oder auch Music Man. Als Remixer arbeitete er z.B. f√ºr Laurent Garnier oder auch Sven V√§th. Seitdem ist der Musiker und Labelinhaber nicht nur mehrfach von diversen Szenemagazinen als bester Produzent ausgezeichnet worden, sondern weltweit in den angesagtesten Clubs und auf den gr√∂√üten Festivals zu Gast.

information:
EXIT presents RIKHTER LIVE & AIDEN at PAN Hannover.

Rikhter balances out the wanton destruction with a dose of romance. Performing live, the 44 LABEL GROUP artist knows his way around an earworm. His high velocity tracks glide with hard-edged elegance, softened by his frankly expressive melodic sensibility and rich harmonies.

From New York to Berlin by way of Milan, British-American @aiden is part of a new generation of artists blurring the lines between past, present and future. Her fierce productions blend sounds of industrial, hardcore and rave - the result of her exposure to the frenetic world of US dance music culture combined with the rich musical legacy of her UK roots already earning her a seat at the table of Kobosil's mighty R Label Group.

lineup: Wird nach der Veranstaltung ver√∂ffentlicht, Will be released afterwards
information:
----- english version below ------

Musikalische Leidenschaft, Freundschaft, ehrenamtliche Schaffenskraft und das Erleben von innerlich erf√ºllten Menschen, die als G√§st:innen Teil des Ganzen werden, sind die Elemente, die den Weg zur Entstehung des ‚ÄûTriebwerks‚Äú geebnet haben. Dieser Ort kann als soziokulturelles und gr√∂√ütes Projekt des seit 2017 bestehenden Kollektivs ‚Äûkfpnyx‚Äú verbucht werden. Dabei ist dieses Projekt keineswegs als fertiges Ergebnis zu betrachten. Vielmehr als eine Reise, auf die wir euch einladen. Wir sind gespannt, wo sie hinf√ºhrt.

Die Klubsaison nimmt langsam Fahrt auf und wir freuen uns weiterhin wertvolle Momente mit euch zu erleben - von freier Entfaltung zu Euphorie, getragen von R√ºcksichtnahme und Zusammenhalt.

Musikalisch transportiert wird das von einer Einladung aus Paris - Mitglied des queeren Kollektiv Hypersoft, vernetzt in der lokalen Szene mit einer monatlichen Show bei Rinse France sowie weiteren Aktivit√§ten. Dar√ºber hinaus Auftritte in angesagten Spielst√§tten von New York, London etc. 
Gefolgt von einer Einladung aus Berlin die dem Kollektiv FRAGMENTED: zugeh√∂rig ist und wir durch √ºberzeugende Auftritte willkommen hei√üen. Das Line up startet mit einer unseren etablierten Resident und endet mit einer b2b Premiere aus den eigenen Reihen. 

Wir m√∂chten, dass Musik an erster Stelle steht. Aus diesem Grund ver√∂ffentlichen wir die K√ºnstler:innen ausschlie√ülich im Nachhinein. Lediglich die Zugeh√∂rigkeiten zu Labels, Klubs, Kollektiven oder √Ñhnlichem geben wir vorher als richtungsweisenden Hinweis bekannt. Um euch einen musikalischen Eindruck zu einer anstehenden Veranstaltung zu erm√∂glichen, ver√∂ffentlichen wir ‚ÄûSnippets‚Äú, also kurze DJ bzw. Live Aufnahmen pro K√ºnstler*in in chronologischer Reihenfolge:
(Den Link findet ihr weiter unten auf der Seite, au√üer ihr nutzt die RA App, die diesen nicht anzeigt. Bitte benutzt euren Handybrowser in diesem Fall!)

TEILNAHME
Anmeldung √ºber Pretix, den Link findet ihr weiter unten auf der Seite, au√üer ihr nutzt die RA App, die diesen nicht anzeigt. Bitte benutzt euren Handybrowser in diesem Fall!

FOTOVERBOT / VIDEOVERBOT
Das Fotografieren und Filmen ist nicht erlaubt, um eure Privatsph√§re zu sch√ºtzen und eine freie Entfaltung zu erm√∂glichen.

MITEINANDER
Wir glauben daran, dass es fernab vom Alltag m√∂glich ist, einen sicheren Raum zu schaffen, welcher von Respekt, Offenheit, Wertsch√§tzung und Sensibilit√§t gepr√§gt ist und in dem gemeinschaftlich ein unverwechselbares Erleben auf musikalischer und zwischenmenschlicher Ebene stattfinden kann. Wir wollen uns gegenseitig unterst√ºtzen, indem wir verletzendes und grenz√ºberschreitendes Verhalten und Gedankengut erkennen, als solches benennen und lernen, es zu tabuisieren. Wir begreifen, dass unsere pers√∂nliche Freiheit dort endet, wo die Grenze Anderer beginnt - und kreieren so einen Ort, an dem sich jede Person frei entfalten kann.

Wenn euch unangenehme Situationen auffallen oder ihr sie erfahrt, wendet euch bitte an das Awarenessteam oder die Crew. Damit wir daf√ºr sorgen k√∂nnen, dass sich jede Person uneingeschr√§nkt entfalten kann.
Das Team ist auch f√ºr euch da, wenn ihr euch anderweitig schlecht f√ºhlen solltet.
W√§hrend der Veranstaltung ist das Team durch 2 Personen, weiblich und m√§nnlich gelesen, in wechselnden Schichten vertreten - zu erkennen in heller Kleidung mit roter Aufschrift.



Passion for music, friendship, voluntary creative power and experiencing internally fulfilled people, who become part of the whole as our guests are the elements, that paved the way for the genesis of ‚ÄúTriebwerk‚Äù. This place can be considered as socio-cultural and largest project of the ‚Äúkfpnyx‚Äù collective, which has been existing since 2017. Moreover this project should by no means be seen as a finished result, rather than a journey that we invite you on. We're excited to see where it goes.

 The club season is slowly picking up speed and we look forward to continuing to experience precious moments with you - from free development to euphoria, supported by consideration and cohesion.

Musically, this is transported by an invitation from Paris - member of the queer collective Hypersoft, networked in the local scene with a monthly show at Rinse France and other activities. In addition, performances in trendy venues in New York, London, etc. 
Followed by an invitation from Berlin, which belongs to the collective FRAGMENTED: and which we welcome because of convincing performances. The line up starts with one of our established residents and ends with a b2b premiere from our own ranks. 

We want music to come first. For this reason, the lineups are published retrospectively only. As a guideline we do announce the artists‚Äò affiliation to labels, clubs, collectives or similar in advance. In order to give you a musical impression of an upcoming event, ‚Äúsnippets‚Äù, i.e. short DJ or live recordings per artist, are being uploaded in chronological order:
(A clickable link can be found further down on the page, except in the RA app. Please use your phone browser!)

ENTRY
Registration via Pretix. A clickable the link can be found further down on the page, except in the RA app. Please use your phone browser!

NO PHOTO/VIDEO POLICY
Taking photos or videos is not allowed, to protect the privacy of all guests.


AWARENESS
We believe that it is possible to create a safe space far away from everyday life that is characterized by respect, openness, appreciation and sensitivity and in which a unique experience on a musical and interpersonal level can take place collectively. We want to support each other by recognizing hurtful and intrusive behaviour and ideas, naming them as such and learning to make them taboo. We understand that our personal freedom ends where someone else‚Äôs boundary begins - and thus create a place where every person can develop freely.

If you notice any incorrect behaviour or situation, please contact our awareness team or the crew. So we can make sure, that everybody feels comfortable and everybody can fully unfold.
If you feel bad in any way you can contact the team as well.
During the event, the team is represented by 2 people, male and female, in alternating shifts - recognisable by their bright clothing with red lettering.

information:

Am 12.10.2024 l√§dt das Millennium Kollektiv euch zu einer Nacht voller Rhythmus und Euphorie in die FeierBar in Bielefeld-Steinhagen ein! 
Unter dem Motto "Ton und Tanz" erwartet euch ein elektrisierendes Event, das euch mitrei√üen wird. Seid bereit f√ºr ein einzigartiges Erlebnis, das euch bis in die fr√ºhen Morgenstunden tanzen l√§sst!

Taucht ein in eine Nacht, in der Ton und Tanz verschmelzen und jeder Beat zum Herzschlag der Feier wird. Erlebt das Beste aus House, Techno und allem dazwischen ‚Äì pr√§sentiert von K√ºnstlern, die wissen, wie sie euch in ihren Bann ziehen!

Ort: FeierBar, Bielefeld-Steinhagen

Lasst euch dieses Highlight nicht entgehen ‚Äì kommt vorbei und feiert mit uns! Sichert euch eure Pl√§tze und seid dabei, wenn das Millennium Kollektiv die FeierBar in ein musikalisches Feuerwerk verwandelt.

Sansibar is a distinctive cosmic producer known for transforming intergalactic vibes. As a resident DJ at Kaiku and Post Bar, Sansibar‚Äôs genre-defying sound has made a mark with labels like Kalahari Oyster Cult and Natural Sciences, establishing them as a standout talent in the European music scene. Their eclectic style spans across electro, techno, house, and jungle to expansive downtempo soundscapes filled with euphoria and haze. Expect an extraordinary lineup of artists who will craft an atmospheric soundscape, enhanced by OXI‚Äôs state-of-the-art sound system and immersive lighting. Whether you're a house enthusiast or a disco lover, the energy of this event is bound to captivate all who live for the pulse of electronic beats.

This isn't just another night out‚Äîit's a transformative experience waiting to unfold. Mark your calendars for October 5th and prepare to lose yourself in the rhythm.

event_name: WE WILL DANCE AGAIN - Nova Soli Event
lineup: Sven Weisemann¬†[Mojuba | Freund der Familie, Lux. [IO], John Osborn [DRED Records], Rising Sun [Echochord | Faith Beat], Phonatic [Headroom], Maral Salmassi¬†[Konsequent], Clarisse¬†[Devotion], Matthias Vogt [Polytone Recordings], George P.¬†[Deep Series Recordings], Dj Humus [Jack Off Records], Nico Rosenberg (Live)¬†[INNI], Orik¬†, Rudolph Beuys¬†[Beatrausch], and more TBA
information:
As we approach the anniversary of the massacre of October 7th perpetrated by the terrorist group Hamas in Israel, we invite you to an impressive memorial event for the victims of the Nova Festival, which will take place from 05-06.10.2024 at Club ://about blank. 
At the psytrance festival in the Negev desert alone, roughly 400 young and innocent ravers, who just celebrated life, were brutally murdered. Many more were seriously injured. Hamas kidnapped 40 of them as hostages in the Gaza Strip. There were numerous testimonies of rape and sexual abuse, including gang rape.
One would think that public sympathy and solidarity with the victims would have been heard, especially from the club culture community, which has always prided itself on being ‚Äòone family‚Äô, but the reactions were largely, as in the rest of the cultural and artistic landscape, deafening silence or even relativisation and justification of these obvious atrocities.
‚ÄòWe will dance again‚Äô wants to break this silence and send a strong signal of solidarity and against anti-Semitism, hatred of Israel and the glorification of terror. Because the attack by the Islamist Hamas on the Nova Festival was not just an attack on the visitors to a rave in Israel, but a fundamental attack on the basic values of club culture itself: Love, peace, freedom and unity

The event includes a day and night program with a film screening, panel discussion, reading, dance performance, information stands, Israeli food and a clubnight with DJs and live acts on three floors.

The proceeds will be donated to a foundation that supports the survivors and bereaved of the victims financially and in coping with their trauma.


Timetable:

3pm - 4pm
#NOVA A documentary film by Dan Pe'er

4:30pm - 4:45pm
'Dance in silence'
Dance performance by Adi Amit & Sagi Amir Gros Director & choreography: Sagi Amir Gros

5:15pm - 6pm
Reading with Genia Berg
From her novel 'Last Festival'

6:30pm-7:30pm
Antisemitism in art and culture after october 7th
Panel discussion with
*Jens Balzer ‚Äì journalist, author of 'After Woke'
*Sharon On - theatre and film director
*Maya Roisman - artist and trainer for political education
*Balbina ‚Äì musician and creative director at Polyton
*Maral Salmassi ‚Äì music producer and label operator
*Moderation: Nicholas Potter - Journalist

After panel
An invitation to light a candle in memory of the 404 Nova victims murdered on oct 7th

8pm - 10pm
Music by DJ Rudolph Beuys

From 10:00pm
Clubnight with
Sven Weisemann // Lux. // John Osborn // Rising Sun // Phonatic // Maral Salmassi // Matthias Vogt // Nico Rosenberg (Live) // Clarisse
George P. // Dj Humus // Orik

lineup: BLACK ROOM, , AOIFE x Beatrice (DE)¬†, Chaz Moloney (Live), Janzon , Mascha , , GREEN ROOM, , DJ Speed¬†x DJ Frequency¬†"The Loopmasters", Kedi Bounce¬†[QS1], Serving Suggestions¬†, , RED ROOM, , Sparkling Water Dreams [QS1] , DJ Zur√ºckbleiben Bitte¬†x Paul Munz
information:
October 5th QS1 are back at Renate 

In classic QS1 Fashion we have some new heads joining us, along with our long time friends and Residents. Almost to the day one year ago, we got the chance to host our first takeover in Renate, and it kicked off a whole series of events which we had never seen coming. Opening the doors to a Venue that fits thousands of people, felt truly nerve wracking, but exciting and like a step we wanted to take. 

This chapter to our Renate story will also be our last as a full full venue take over. These takeovers have given us the chance to invite friends to the stage and give the platform to people who we feel have really earned it. Thanks to all included once again for the unwavering support, assistance and love. You know who you are <3

This time is no different:

Delivering Tunes on Saturday 5th will be:

Aoife x Beatrice
Chaz Moloney
DJ Speed x DJ Frequency
DJ Zur√ºckbleiben Bitte x Paul Munz
Janzon
Kedi Bounce
Mascha
Serving Suggestions
Sparkling Water Dreams

See you on the dancefloor 


Born from an unrenovated apartment building in Friedrichshain, across the river from Treptower Park, Renate has three main dance floors and many smaller rooms to explore. Every shade and subgenre of electronic music has its place here, from fast, groovy techno to uplifting house music, from chugging EBM to frenetic breakbeat stompers.

‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê ‚òê

The non-smoking regulations apply in the club. Smoking is only permitted in the garden.

Tickets are available at the door. RA ticket does not guarantee entry; purchased tickets will be refunded in that case. Box office 22‚Ç¨ (incl. 2‚Ç¨ wardrobe).

Please note we are fully cashless, we ONLY accept CARD payments at the club.

In case you feel that you have been treated wrongly, or that your space has been violated, please notify our awareness team or our staff.

information:
Der Schwede Alexander Berg etablierte sich zu Beginn des letzten Jahrzehnts zun√§chst als Teil des Duos Genius of Time und sp√§ter als Solok√ºnstler unter dem Namen Dorisburg mit einem pr√§zisen, hypnotischen Tech-House-Sound. Nachdem er und sein Label Aniara 2023 aus einem vierj√§hrigen Winterschlaf erwacht sind, ist er wieder so alert und pr√§sent wie eh und je ‚Äì nach dem frei flie√üenden Ambient-Album That Who Remembers, das er zusammen mit Sebastian Mullaert f√ºr Spazio Disponibile aufgenommen hat, ver√∂ffentlicht er auch wieder seine ausgedehnten, h√∂hlenartigen Dancefloor-Grooves mit glitzernden Melodien. Dorisburg spielt live in der S√§ule zur heutigen Klubnacht. Ebenfalls live pr√§sentiert der Portugiese N√∏rbak seine Musik im Berghain ‚Äì nach Releases auf Axis, Hayes und Mord deb√ºtiert er in diesem Jahr mit einer starken 4-Track-EP auf Token, auf der er eine perfekte Balance zwischen Rauheit und technischer Tiefe und Finesse h√§lt. Freuen kann man sich auch auf ein DJ-Set des kalifornischen Techno-Produzenten Developer, der nach einem f√ºnfj√§hrigen Hiatus wieder im Berghain auflegt.

Hailing from Sweden, Alexander Berg first made a splash a decade and a half ago first as half the duo Genius of Time, then as a solo artist under the name Dorisburg, pushing a precise, hypnotic tech-house sound. Now that he and his label Aniara came out of a four-year hibernation, he is as alert and present as ever ‚Äì after recording the free-flowing ambient album That Who Remembers with Sebastian Mullaert for Spazio Disponibile, he's now back to releasing his sprawling, cavernous dancefloor grooves with glittering melodies. Dorisburg will be playing live in S√§ule for this edition of Klubnacht. On the Berghain floor, also presenting his music live is Portugal's N√∏rbak ‚Äì after releases on Axis, Hayes and Mord, he linked up with Token this year for a strong 4-track EP, striking the perfect balance between rawness and technical depth and finesse. You can also look forward to a DJ set by Californian techno producer Developer, back at Berghain after a five-year hiatus.

promoters: Badehaus Szimpla, xcuse:u, Badehaus Musik GmbH
lineup: sleeptwitch (xcuse:u), ayu bi¬†(xcuse:u), elliephunk¬†(casadephunk) , Vanessa Vegas (xcuse:u alumini)
information:
xcuse:u¬†takes over House of Bade at Badehaus, bringing along a stellar lineup to fill the night with eclectic sounds and community vibes.

This night is going to be special, filled with colorfully curated tunes, dancefloor liberation, and an incredible sense of community.

At House of Bade, we do not tolerate any form of discrimination‚Äîwhether it's racism, sexism, queerphobia, or any toxic behavior. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating a safer space for all. If you feel uncomfortable or need help, our team and venue staff are always available.

More about the line-up:

The Berlin DJ and culture collective xcuse:u e.V. was founded in June 2022 by Ele, Kiki, Freya and Chiara with the help of a grant from Popkultur Lokal. The aim of the collective is to take progressive steps towards an inclusive club culture. With their events dedicated to the political aspects of club culture - such as representation, empowerment, safer spaces and raising awareness of discrimination - they want to create community spaces where people can inform themselves and raise awareness through workshops on (queer) feminist topics. xcuse:u wants to show that it is possible to make club nights safer, more non-discriminatory and more supportive. The representation of FLINTA* artists is clearly in the foreground - but the events are open to all supporters.



ayu bi always aims to abandon genres and borders, far away from a musical binary
they are weaving sounds from ear, to hips, to feet and through ur eyes - into a state of increased awareness for our surroundings, our fellow humans and the fibers of our interconnections.
music in its vibrant, lustrous diversity is meant to be celebrated.
life is too short for borders in the present,
let us tear down these limiting beliefs all together.
in ecstasy we free ourselves and on the dance floor,
we unite body, mind and collective purpose.


Sleeptwitch is one for the nerds: bringing the oldschool sounds to life with a focus on electro, detroit sounds and dreamy robotic music. This time they prepared a special mixture from acid house, to fun classics and everything in between.
Actively engaged in Berlin's music scene, she hosts two ongoing radio shows at Cashmere Radio and Systems Radio and is part of two collectives (@xcuseu.kollektiv @crush.kollektiv), organizing female and queer focused events, workshops, DJ sessions, and much more.

elliephunk is an avid SoundCloud surfer, old-time CD collector, and Berlin based, Taiwanese-American artist who has an unwavering passion for community building, and curating soundscapes that move the soul. Her sets are often lined with a groovy, punchy bass, and her body-moving selects generally pull from a housey mix of minimal bounce, handbag vocals, jazzy instrumentals, rhythmic beats, and UKG breaks... she‚Äôs also known for sprinkling in '80s soul, and nostalgic ‚Äô90s RnB/hip-hop samples for extra flavor.
Beyond the decks: As founder, catalyst, and ‚Äúmain mamacita‚Äù at casadephunk (a.k.a. casa), she‚Äôs taking an offbeat approach to event curation and shaping a new community around the concept ‚Äúcasa = house = home‚Äù. Bouncing between cozy, elevated in-house programs, and thoughtfully cute club nights, casa‚Äôs events bring together a diverse mix of artists from a wide range of disciplines: from visual to design, to fashion, to live music, to DJs and producers from various experience levels.

Vannessa Vegas, French born and Berlin-based, Sophie, aka Vanessa Vegas, has always had a deep connection to music. Her passion began on the dance floors, where countless hours spent immersing herself in the beats shaped her musical identity.
Having made her debut behind the decks during xcuse:u‚Äôs last DJ workshop, she brings a sweet tooth for 90s house, vocals, and high-energy grooves.

event_name: Rhythm Section Berlin: Bradley Zero, Elias Mazian, JADA, MLE
lineup: Bradley Zero¬†Elias Mazian¬†JADA¬†MLE (UK)
information:
Berlin! We're returning to Ohm with some old and new friends for a good ole' RS dance going all night long. 

We'll be joined by Amsterdam based DJ and producer Elias Mazian, a firm fixture of the club circuit in Amsterdam and beyond His DJ sets are never predictable, with house music forming a base to deviate from into all manner of unexpected sounds, be it jungle, techno or a classic pop song. The former Trouw and De School resident is refreshingly unafraid to share his sensitive side on the emotional journeys that form his dj sets, productions and radio shows. 

Also joining us is JADA a multidisciplinary artist known for her vibrant selection. Her characteristically joyful sets consist of catchy grooves and soulful nuances between house, breakbeat and bass music. Blending r&b, rap, baile funk and afro influences in-between she dives into the spectrum of sub-genres and conceptualises new soundscapes - the intersection of progressive dance music.

These two great DJ'S will be sandwiched between RS residents MLE and BZ who always put on a great show.


SEE YOU IN THE DANCE!
TWO RULES
1. Be nice
2. No photos on the dance floor plz... (take them outside before u get in )

event_name: Molly Nilsson 'Un-American Activities' Record Release Show
lineup: Molly Nilsson, Apostille
information:
On Oct 5th at 90mil, Shameless/Limitless proudly presents the record release show for Molly Nilsson‚Äôs 11th studio album, "Un-American Activities‚Äù (Dark Skies Association / Night School), a conceptual work written and recorded in Los Angeles in spring 2024, and a project in support of which which only a very limited number of shows will be played.

Support comes via the Glasgow based Night School Records recording artist and longtime partner in Un-American Activities and beyond, Apostille.

‚Äî
In Molly Nilsson‚Äôs words:

These songs were recorded during the first quarter of 2024 as part of the Villa Aurora residency program held at the former home of Lion and Marta Feuchtwanger (n√©e L√∂ffler) in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles.

Lion Feuchtwanger, born July 7, 1884, was a German Jewish novelist and playwright. Born into an affluent family ‚Äì his father owned a margarine factory in Munich ‚Äì Feuchtwanger was the oldest of nine siblings, two of whom also became authors. An early and outspoken opponent of the National Socialists, Feuchtwanger was among the first to be declared an official enemy of the state in Germany. His books were subsequently burnt, and his citizenship revoked.

In 1933, the now stateless Feuchtwanger sought safety in France. There, however, he would be imprisoned twice. First with the declaration of war in 1939, and again in 1940 after Hitler invaded France. With the SS drawing closer, Feuchtwanger managed to escape captivity following the intervention of, among others, First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt. A long-time reader who happened to recognise his face in a photo of work camp inmates, Roosevelt helped to facilitate his treacherous escape from Europe. Arriving in Portugal via Spain, he boarded a ship bound for America: the Excalibur. Travelling with a false passport under the name ‚ÄúWetcheeks,‚Äù the literal English translation of his name, Feuchtwanger crossed the Atlantic. He arrived in America in 1941.

The Feuchtwangers eventually settled in the outskirts of Los Angeles, purchasing their home for $9,000, equivalent to the annual salary of a teacher at that time. From 1943, he continued to work and write alongside famous, LA-based exiles like Bertolt Brecht and Thomas Mann. Both were close friends and frequent house guests ‚Äì though never both at the same time. He and his wife Marta established themselves in their villa, which became a meeting point, literary salon, and a bastion for anti-fascists and leftist intellectuals on the West Coast.

As World War II ended and the Cold War began, wartime allies became new enemies. In the McCarthy era ‚ÄúRed Scare‚Äù that ensued, suspicion of leftists turned into hatred. Thousands of real or suspected communists were persecuted in a series of public hearings held by the Committee of Un-American Activities. Many of those called as witnesses were humiliated, defamed, and blacklisted as a result. Countless lives and careers were destroyed by these hearings, and many suicides followed in their wake. Bertolt Brecht left America the day after taking the witness stand, never to return. Lion Feuchtwanger never had to face the committee, but his association with and open sympathy for the USSR prevented him from obtaining American citizenship, and thereby a passport with which to travel.

Lion Feuchtwanger died in 1956 after fifteen years in the USA. He was still stateless at the time of his death. Marta continued to live in the villa until her passing in 1986, leaving the estate and its immense library, which included more than 20,000 volumes, to USC. The property was eventually sold to the German state, which it now uses to host artist residencies, with several fellowships in various artistic fields provided each year.

This record commemorates the 140th birthday of Lion Feuchtwanger.

‚Äî

This event will take place at 90mil, a non-profit, DIY space near Jannowitzbr√ºcke, Berlin. Entrance is via suggested donation at the door only. You must be a member to enter. You can become a member by purchasing a membership card at the door for ‚Ç¨5. This card is valid for a year. See less

information:
It‚Äôs been one hell of a HOT ASS SUMMER 
But as the nights draw in and the days get shorter, your favourite BASSment rumbles in anticipation and itching underneath the Stra√üe of Mehringdamm are the bass junkies, sound nerds and sub headed freaks‚Ä¶.and they‚Äôre raring to go! 

We‚Äôve had a cheeky little summer break (hard and fast as it may have been) but we are BACK and ready to serve you up your next dose of DnB Served to you by some of the industry‚Äôs sexiest, sassiest and fiercest FLINTA‚Äôs‚Ä¶.lets get pumped for FACILITATE. 

Join us for part 3 of our underground FLINTA DnB party where we welcome Berlin and Paris QUEEN SoyKl≈ç and Balkan Baddie Souci !
You will also be kindly hosted by FACILITATE. Mamas DJ Flounce and DJ NORTHERN.

Put it in your diary, click attending and let‚Äôs fill that tiny bassment with a bunch of Bass lovin‚Äò cuties !!! 

We are a femmes to the front and queer safe event space where we firmly believe in consideration to the space we take up on the dance floor. Privilege to be acknowledged. Care and kindness to be given. Moments to be shared.
Mosh pit bros to the back. You are welcome here but take note of the above! 

Any kind of sexism, racism, homophobia, transphobia, discrimination, aggressive or predatory behaviour won‚Äôt be tolerated. We want to create a safe space where people can feel love, be free and feel safe.

Can‚Äôt wait to see you all there!
Much love, 
Your FACILITATE. gals xox

information:

lineup: Aleks BLC , Kidcat¬†& ilbroccolovolante¬†, Lena Brecht b2b LeVe , MI$ JUNIA
information:
Back for round two, Ap√©ro Club XL

The match made in heaven is matching again. Pillow Princess and What a Playground are once again teaming up bringing all the housey sounds that keep us moving. Together, we‚Äôre crafting another 12+ hour journey of music, community, and love at Crack Bellmer including a lovely guest from Copenhagen, one of our Berlin favourites and three hours of open decks to support fresh talent. 

From the soft glow of the aperitif to the pulse of the dance floor, we‚Äôll guide you from happy hour to after hour, with nothing but good vibes and a place for everybody. 

 

Like during our first edition we‚Äòll start early with three slots of open decks to provide space DJs to play first sets within a club setting. To apply for one of the slots please use the link in @pillow.princess.berlin & @what_a_playground bios and highlights.

At the door, we‚Äôll be collecting donations to support @kop_berlin which stands for "Kampagne f√ºr Opfer rassistisch motivierter Polizeigewalt‚Äù. This campaign works to support and advocate for individuals who have experienced racial profiling, discrimination, and violence at the hands of the police, raising awareness about systemic racism within law enforcement. Let's dance with purpose and come together to make a difference ‚ô°

Your Pillow Princess & What a Playground crews

bring a friend, not an attitude.

lineup: Love Leya, Dom Hyuga¬†, Will Tran, C3MSTA, Rapha Garc√©s
information:
Welcome to the newest and best project of the Berlin house music scene:
Pomelo Members Club
October 5, 2024 / 11PM-Late
@marmor_bar

DJs:

We are thrilled to have Dom Hyuga (@yami_club), one of Berlin‚Äôs hottest house DJs ( only god knows what‚Äôs in his small bag he‚Äôs always with ) spinning his signature beats. Known for headlining the capital‚Äôs best parties, Dom‚Äôs electrifying sets are guaranteed to keep you moving.

Love Leya, the rising star from Frankfurt, is taking the scene by storm. Since being booked by @keinemusikcrue for the exclusive Audemars Piguet event in Switzerland, her career is set to soar to new heights! See u soon Leya.

Will Tran, a Vietnamese-American artist who crafts sets that seamlessly merge cultural influences with pulsating beats. Recognizable by an iconic pink telephone, Will has graced the decks at Soho House Berlin and Georgia Bar, while also completing a two-month tour across Vietnam.

Rapha Garc√©s is an Ecuadorian DJ who now lives in Berlin. You can only love this positively crazy man.
He regularly enlivens the crowd with his Latin house mixed with minimal beats. He used to play at the best clubs. I don‚Äôt know what we love more his hair or his music.
We are very happy to have you with us Rapha.

C3MSTA started DJing less than a year ago and has managed to inspire people in Europe with his music in such a short time. Wait and see what the guy with the Colgate smile has prepared for you.

Location:

Marmor bar is located in the heart of Berlin‚Äôs electronic music scene. High class sound system meets aesthetic flair, good atmosphere and perfect drinks. What else do you need?

Please Note:

Due to the huge demand we had to turn away several hundred people at the last events. Please come early to increase your chances of getting in. Please don‚Äôt push at the door and take care of each other.

Even the organizers cannot place themselves above the security policy of the city of Berlin, please respect that.

Entrance fee is cash only

information:
Die Mystic Creatures haben sich in 2024 nochmal tiefer mit dem Bahnw√§rter Thiel verbandelt. Der Kunst & Kulturort aus M√ºnchen besteht seit 2015 und will "einen Beitrag zur Formung einer reflektierten, respektvollen und weitsichtigen Gesellschaft" liefern. "Ein Ort f√ºr Begegnungen auf Augenh√∂he, bei dem der Phantasie keine Schranken gesetzt sind."
Wir freuen uns sehr diese beiden Crews bei uns auf dem Dach zu haben ‚Äì vom Nachmittag in die Nacht, mit wunderbarer elektronischer Musik, Austausch und wilder Feierei.

[EN]
This year the Mystic Creatures crew spun closer bonds with the Munich based Art- & Culturespace Bahnw√§rter Thiel. Since 2015 Banhw√§rter Thiel is a project offering Urban Gardening, studios, ateliers, a youth-club, a bistro and various cultural events like clubnights, concerts and much more at their big venue located right next to the railroad tracks. We are very happy to host these amazing crews together ‚Äì for a special edition of "Mystic Tales above the clouds".

RELMS SESSION 004 in BERLIN at STUDIO1111 w/



Bapari (Dj Set)

Bapari is a Haitian-American musician, producer and DJ. They recently released their EP Oasis via Halcyon Veil featuring collaborations with singers Lolahol and Kid√§. Last summer, they released their EP Stamina with the Mexico City label NAAFI and their 2021 release ‚ÄúDaybreak‚Äù was named a best track of 2021 by Resident Advisor. Bapari is a four-time Boiler Room performer and has hosted the monthly show Puffy on NTS Radio since 2019.

Nico ADOMAKO 

Nico Adomako (he/him) is a Berlin and Accra-based trans-disciplinary artist, DJ, curator, and programmer. 
He is active and interested in various forms of social and cultural events and has been brewing a globally-minded, rich new perspective on Berlin's and Accra‚Äôs music and art scene, empowering and uplifting his community.
Nico co-founded the Ghana-based online radio station Oroko Radio as well as the legendary Berlin club night Einhundert under which he has produced raves, exhibitions, and concerts on a global scale from Berlin and New York to Hong Kong, Accra, Tokyo, Paris, London, Amsterdam, Frankfurt and Los Angeles.

Her ability to curate music is both intuitive and refined, seamlessly crafting sound environments that elevate the experience of any space. Whether she is creating the perfect auditory backdrop for a sun-soaked shoreline, an enigmatic industrial setting, or a nature-bound, site-specific gathering that incorporates elements such as culinary delights, installations, fashion, or film, Rachel excels in composing scores and playlists that effortlessly enhance the ambiance. lineup: Anna Mieke, Muireann Bradley , Conor
information:
This weekend edition of Kiezsalon returns to our familiar stomping grounds, the Musikbrauerei. Following Friday‚Äôs lineup of Svitlana Nianio, Romarna Campbell and Atsuko Hatano, it continues Saturday with a focus on Irish music. Traversing the nation‚Äôs diverse artistic landscape, we will present dreamy folk musician Anna Mieke, blues revivalist Muireann Bradley making her Berlin debut, electronic music newcomer producer Conor and Gash Collective founder and DJ ELLLL.

Originally from Wicklow, Ireland, Anna Mieke is a vocalist and multi-instrumentalist whose lyricism and enveloping compositions straddle the line between folk forms and vivid dreamscapes, drawing on traditional and contemporary motifs. The duality of reality and romanticism forms the thematic core of Theatre, her second album issued by Nettwerk in 2022 that ‚Äúmines a rich seam of nostalgia and loss ‚Äì and her extensive travels‚Äù as The Guardian summarised in their four-star review of the record.

Muireann Bradley is a 17-year-old fingerpicking guitarist and singer from County Donegal, Ireland, specialising in country, ragtime, and Piedmont blues from the 1920s and 1930s. During the 2020 lockdowns, she began uploading videos to YouTube and quickly gained attention with her rendition of Blind Blake‚Äôs ‚ÄúPolice Dog Blues‚Äù, leading to an album offer from Tompkins Square. Her album I Kept These Old Blues was released in late 2023, featuring live studio recordings that echo the classic country blues artists of the early 20th century. The Irish Times gave the ‚Äúimpressive and hugely promising‚Äù debut four stars.

In his latest musical endeavour, Berlin-based Irish artist Conor is driven by an exploration of dancefloor sounds that juxtapose functionality and abstraction. From ambient and downtempo to industrial and glitch, his eclectic taste converges into a singular, forward-thinking sound that defies easy categorisation. With the premiere of his live set, Conor is also celebrating the upcoming release of his debut album on Digital in Berlin.

We are always happy to be back at the 120-year-old building of the Musikbrauerei in Prenzlauer Berg. Tucked away between Greifswalder Stra√üe and Volkspark Friedrichshain, the former Schneider brewery is a rare building in former East Berlin for having survived, unspoiled, the creeping tide of gentrification. As we usually sell out, we recommend booking tickets in advance.

lineup: Fluffy Maybes, Pretty Average, Bed
information:
Pretty Average invited the bands Bed and Fluffy Maybes to accompany them in their September tour stop in Berlin to complete a sonic experience that we won't forget.

Pretty Average strives to bring a fresh musical perspective to Berlin, that of a frontwoman who sets out to make a difference with her songwriting. Candy sings her songs in a gender-indistinct manner, backed by the distortion and the raw sound that Sergi has been developing since relocating to Berlin himself. They haven't stopped working on their music ever since. They intend to develop musically to help establish a musical counter-culture that resists today‚Äôs nihilism. A value that has been part of the band's identity since its beginning in late 2021.Last year Francisco Parisi produced the band for their latest release ‚ÄúAll I wanted‚Äù, they published two editions of vinyl run, the first edition being sold out. Currently organising to keep working on singles with him until next year.

BED is a Berlin based band founded by Argentinian bass player Sol Astolfi and Chilean vocalist Nicol√°s Astorga in 2021. After initial experimentation and writing sessions, they invited German guitarist Ema Schiller to join. After the recording sessions for their first album, Turkish musician Eylul Deniz joined the ensemble. At its core, BED is a queer musical project, with a sound rooted in shoegaze, dream pop and post punk. Their lyrics are sad and sexual, weaving together threads of both vulnerability and desire, producing a body of work that challenges normative creative expression. This is exemplified in the vocalizations, which are intentionally gender ambiguous, representing a fluid identity throughout the album. Inspired by musicians such as Liz Harris (Grouper), Kevin Shields (My Bloody Valentine), Elizabeth Fraser (Cocteau Twins), Courtney Love (Hole) and Bowery Electric, the band winds together iconic elements of the 90s scene, layered with ambient and influenced by the Berlin rave scene. On the upcoming release, BED collaborated with electronic music producer Cybermission, who contributed drums and synth on the first single. EVERYTHING HURTS, the introductory track to the intimate glistening universe of BED is an angelic cry for help: a swan song to save a breaking relationship or to repair a broken heart.

Fluffy Maybes ÊùæËΩØËÆ∏ËØ∫ is a kind of soft promise that may not be kept, a transcontinental musical experiment birthed in the pandemic. Finally meeting in person and under unexpected quarantine conditions, Jingyun and Robin recorded six hours of improvised sessions which eventually formed the single ‚ÄòUnnatural Disaster‚Äô and the forthcoming EP. Moving through sounds of early electronica, sun-drenched psychedelia, and floating ambience, Fluffy Maybes ÊùæËΩØËÆ∏ËØ∫ generate moments of spontaneous sonic playfulness, hypnotic pulses from other worlds and evolving waves of nature-inspired synthesis. Whatever happens in the future, at least for now we can shower you with some fluffy maybes.

information:
The demo station by Rirkrit Tiravanija is a stage-like sculpture that invites people to ‚Äúdemonstrate‚Äù something. Tiravanija plays with the different meanings of the term ‚Äúdemonstration‚Äù as both a political protest and a presentation of someone‚Äôs talent or hobby. For the duration of the exhibition, the demo station provides a space for daily public performances.
The demo station is activated daily (except on the closing day on Tuesday) between 15:00 and 17:00 with various events. From DJ sets and concerts to workshops and readings, the varied programme invites you to watch, listen or participate. The demo station is located in the atrium of the Gropius Bau, the events are free of charge and accessible without a ticket to the exhibition.
During the event, photographs and video recordings may be made in which you may be recognisable. By attending, you consent to these recordings being used to communicate the event or exhibition.

lineup: FUJI‚Äã|‚Äã|‚Äã|‚Äã|‚Äã|‚Äã||‚Äã|‚Äã|‚Äã|‚Äã|‚ÄãTA (live), Margaux¬†(live)
information:
FUJI||||||||||TA is a Sound Artist and composer based in Japan. He creates his unique sound art and music which takes various natural phenomena that respond to his interest in wanting to hear unheard sounds and noises. In 2009 Fujita hand fabricated an original instrument, a Pipe Organ. Since then, he has released a number of different sets, but what he have in common is that his expressions are mainly use the sounds of air and minimal. 
This year he released his new album ‚ÄúMMM‚Äù on Hallow Ground.

~

As a sound artist, Margaux Gazur explores possibilities of sounds, using unconventional instruments, everyday objects and field recording to create a rich and textured soundscape. She studied classical piano at the Conservatoire. Over time, she became increasingly interested in the possibilities of unconventional sound sources and started to incorporate these into her compositions. Using everyday objects and sounds from surrounding environments allow her to create music that is both deeply personal and universally resonant.

lineup: Aleks BLC, Balthazar Martinez, Feasting, Fluffi, ilbroccolovolante , Kidcat, Mamede, materia hache¬†, Stella Zekri, Triqi¬†, Valentin, VERTEL¬†, Victor Kubin
information:
To be asked WHERE WERE YOU?
and you can answer I WAS THERE
on Sunday, October 6 at @mena.berlin starting at 7p.m.
A Ron Hardy documentary fundraiser party

There is a legend of a night between 1982 and 1987, at the Music Box in Chicago, when Ron Hardy left a mix running while the dance floor was still vibrating to the music. The booth seemed empty, but the music wouldn‚Äôt stop, creating a surreal and magical atmosphere. Attendees say that, although no one could see Ron Hardy, they felt his presence through the music, as if he was controlling the energy of the party in an almost mystical way.

We invite you to relive that experience. Feel free to explore the space, what do you hear? Feel the power of music propelling your body to explore by dancing. Imagine that you were there, that it is now, a temporary space that repeats itself while the experience is new and yet not. Those sounds are familiar, they are the legacy Ron left to our constant attempts to build community around the groove, and protest by dancing, because we exist and resist.

*Come and support with whatever you can this documentary about Ron Hardy‚Äôs life, because oral history is lost and we can‚Äôt afford it. #pleasedonate

Thanks to all the DJs who, with their music and love for House music, will help give Ronnie the place he deserves.

- - - - - 

From @OtherstotheFront we call on all creatures saved by the feeling of House music to donate and give support to @iwastheredoc - a documentary about the Life of Ron Hardy, which is also the history of House and at the same time our history.

Resident of the ‚ÄúMuzic Box‚Äù - an inclusive space where different realities converged: Black, Latinxs, LGBTQ+ people, and music lovers from various walks of life - Ron Hardy was always keeping this atmosphere alive, reflecting a club culture geared towards freedom, escape, and self-expression.

We always have loved that Hardy was not afraid to break the rules and experiment with new sounds. He understood the power of music as a force to bring people together, and his ability to mix genres and styles contributed to that diversity on the dance floor. Through his music, Hardy created an environment where social and cultural barriers dissolved on the dance floor.

Nothing would be the same without Hardy, this is why we are here talking about Ronnie now.

Let‚Äôs give him the place he deserves in (our) history. We owe it to Ron, and to future generations to keep his story alive. #pleasedonate make it happen! #savethedates
6.OCT @mena.berlin
24.OCT @fitzroyclub
#staytuned more updates coming soon!

"The money raised  from the event will go towards an interview shoot in Chicago in November with Robert Williams - the man responsible for giving Ron Hardy and Frankie Knuckles there starts, as the founder of The Muzic Box and The Warehouse."

lineup: tba
Visage, Queenie Starr, Martini Cherry Furter, The Incredible, Edible, Akynos with Angel Maxine, Michelle Tshibo, Jade Lee, Exocee and Savannah Morgan, Liquid Brain Orchestra
information:
Little Woman, BIG HAIR Presents: Black H'or Futurism

An Immersive Theatrical Experience Inspired by Octavia Butler's "Parable of the Sower"

Berlin, Germany ‚Äì August 6, 2024 ‚Äì Little Woman, BIG HAIR Productions is thrilled to continue their collaboration with The Black Sex Worker Collective (BSWC) in the 2024 theme for the ongoing performance and storytelling series Heaux Tales with the latest socially engaged theatrical performance project theme: Black H'or Futurism. Part of the ongoing campaign for visibility, inclusion, the DEcriminalization of bodies and financial stability for The Black Sex Worker Collective - Berlin, this year‚Äôs theme is loosely inspired by Octavia Butler's speculative fiction novel "Parable of the Sower." 
Black H'or Futurism is a groundbreaking performance that delves into the sexual creative energies of Black Sex Workers in the fight for environmental justice, land rights, and labor rights with the backdrop of technology. In fragments, this production encourages the reimagining and reclamation of the displaced bodies and minds of those forced to the margins by social inequalities.
In over 24 hours of interdisciplinary and intersectional artistry, attendees enter the irresistible imagination of the central operating mind of a sleeping Black Sex Worker, portrayed by artist MF Akynos. Where in her dreamscape, a world unfolds fragmented dreams and false awakenings that explore the morbid realities, joy, and resilience within queer and migrant communities. Here, we find our roots in Afro futurism and African parables. Where our perception of darkness is challenged, the ancestors come to life, technology has greatly advanced, and onlookers access the transformative idea that sex work is part of our human future and that theories and practices of sex work developed by Sex Workers are essential in melding technologies, global Black experiences, and paths for radical tomorrows. 
Black H‚Äôor Futurism is profane, dirty, transgressive, posits future worlds built by and reflecting the experiences of people of African descent. Excerpts of the show will incorporate music, rest & rehabilitation and food. Commencing on October 6 through 7, the experience takes place at Berlin's own transformative artistic space, 90 Mil. A bevy of surprise guest artists will interpolate intersectional art within the conceptual dreamscape of creator and BSWC executive director, The Incredible, Edible, Akynos. Alongside original performances and stories by BSWC-Berlin members: Queenie Starr, Visage, and Angel Maxine. With guest performances by Liquid Brain Orchestra, Exocee, Savannah Morgan, Jade Lee, Michelle Tshibo, Mia on Acid, Edie Montana, and more!

Advanced ticket purchasing is highly encouraged. Those who cannot attend in person are welcomed to purchase tickets for communities who otherwise cannot afford to attend. Sales go towards the ongoing project creation which directly supports people of multiple marginalized backgrounds.

lineup: Hannes Kretzer - Triloka - The Four - Raz O'Hara & Lihli - Andromeda Mega Express Orchestra - Primeiro
information:
SANCTUM OF SOUND IS A MUSICAL FORUM FOR LISTENERS OF SACRED SOUND IN MAHALLA.

Curated and produced by the MaHalla team every first sunday of the month Sanctum of Sound will transform MaHalla for 12 hours from 12pm to 12am into a sacred space that is worshipping the creation and transmission of music and sound.

HANNES KRETZER
12PM ‚Äì 2PM

Hannes Kretzer presents an immersive ambient sound experience, utilizing a quadrophonic setup to immerse the audience in spatial layers of textured sound. The performance will feature new material alongside previously released compositions, weaving together the resonant tones of the Cristal Baschet‚Äîan instrument known for its haunting, otherworldly resonance‚Äîand the deep, immersive vibrations of custom-built gong resonator speakers. This rich and dynamic sonic environment blurs the line between the organic and the electronic, guiding listeners into a reflective and meditative state.

TRILOKA
2PM ‚Äì 4PM

TRILOKA offers an augmented sonic experience through the interaction of live acoustic and electronic instruments for meditative explorations, silent contemplation and the unfolding of the body-mind in the form of extended ambient sound journeys.The intercultural trio guides an immersive and introspective‚ÄØjourney by combining the soothing melodies of the acoustic cello, the contemporary and psychedelic sound sculptures of the effected and processed electric guitar and the grounding frequencies of the gong and singing bowls.All of that while you comfortably sit or lay down, close your eyes, meditate, dream along or float away in the amazing space of MaHalla.

THE FOUR
4PM ‚Äì 6PM

For each Sanctum of Sound, the music Ashram puts together a 4-piece formation of guest musicians and members of the Ashram.

RAZ O‚ÄôHARA & LIHLA
6PM ‚Äì 8PM

Rich and diverse in its sonic palette, Raz Ohara‚Äôs music shifts from soothing ambient textures, and harshly distorted synth peaks, to cinematic soundscapes interwoven with avant-garde contemporary classical and jazz music. His unique vocal style is imbued with a soulful and beautiful strangeness, an ability to convey deep lyrics of love, loss, introspection and exploration of emotional and spiritual themes.Classically trained cellist, composer and storyteller Lihla (Lih Qun Wong) combines a vast instrumental skillset of piano, cello, electronics and spoken word, to craft intensely immersive aural-hallucinatory worlds of intricately shifting landscapes. Classical instruments capture the meeting place between memory and longing, while explorational vocal and cello styles invoke and echo the ancient, the feminine, and the otherworldly.In their new collaboration, ‚ÄúAn offering‚Äù dreamlike cinematic instrumental and electronic soundscapes take us through vast landscapes of reflection, dream state and memory. Storytelling and song guides us, as a link to our collective memory and a means to navigate inner landscapes. Setting the path for a poetic and deeply haunting journey through the internal psyche that is truly transportive and escapist.

ANDROMEDA MEGA EXPRESS ORCHESTRA
8PM ‚Äì 10PM

A self-organized, independent group of likeminded individuals, AMEO is unlike any other orchestra: It‚Äôs a steadily working ensemble with a steady focus on experimentation. It is comprised of in-demand musicians hailing from various countries and musical backgrounds. ‚ÄØDaniel Glatzel, the orchestra‚Äôs leader and saxophonist is also its main composer and producer.Widely celebrated for its explosive, intense live shows ‚Äì surprisingly accessible and infectious despite the musical complexity ‚Äì AMEO‚Äôs concerts are essentially colorful sonic adventure trips that cannot possibly be repeated or foreseen.

PRIMEIRO
10PM ‚Äì 12AM

Primeiro is an experimental electronic artist from Buenos Aires, Argentina. His music transcends conventional boundaries, delving into the realms of ambient, hand-made trance, and techno. While his work may initially evoke a sense of tranquility akin to artists like Hiroshi Yoshimura, a closer examination reveals intricate layers and meticulous arpegios.In 2023, he released his first album, ‚ÄúMusic for Horses,‚Äù with the Berlin-based label Danzee. He organizes the Feed the River festival, expressing that rivers are living beings and like all beings they need to be nourished, inspired by the concept of Animism and the use of sound to foster meaningful transformative dialogues.As part of the group Lujo Asi√°tico, he has released three vinyl albums then touring in Europe and Japan.

event_name: Tag der Clubkultur - Bass Down the Iron Curtain
lineup: Gregor Rozanski, Zambon¬†(The Very Polish Cut Outs)
information:
At the end of the 1980s, club scenes characterized by electronic house and techno sounds reached a critical mass. At the same time, all socialist governments in Central and Eastern Europe fell; there was initially a spirit of optimism and hope for more freedom and democracy. Techno in particular became the soundtrack to political and social change. As a contribution to the Day of Club Culture 2024, Soundwatch presents films and sounds from the early post-socialist party scene and reflects on their echoes today.

German premiere

Rave OmeU
PL 2024 76 min Directors: ≈Åukasz Ronduda, Dawid Nickel
With little-seen archive footage of parties and art happenings, the film tells the story of the development of rave music and subculture in Poland. Two young ravers guide us through this world: Marysia and Janusz, as well as Marcello Zamenhoff - a performance artist and one of the pioneers of Polish rave. A fundamental question for the protagonists is how the young generation can overcome the classism in the Polish techno scene, which has been pronounced since its beginnings in the 90s.

≈ÅUKASZ RONDUDA is a feature film director and curator at the Museum of Modern Art in Warsaw. His films explore unusual forms of representing art and artistic processes. His debut PERFORMER won the ‚ÄúThink:Film Award‚Äù at the Berlin International Film Festival. His second film, A HEART OF LOVE, was presented at several international film festivals, including Berlin and Rotterdam. RAVE builds upon the exhibition ‚Äú140 Beats per Minute‚Äù which he curated about techno culture and art in Poland in the 1990s.

DAWID NICKEL focuses on telling the stories of people who are perceived stereotypically because of their sexual orientation or social status. His first feature film LOVE TASTING was awarded the main prize in the micro-budget section at the Polish Film Festival. In 2023, his latest productions premiered: FILIPKA, a short documentary about his queer and gender-fluid friend, and the high-end TV series for HBO Max, #BRING BACK ALICE.

Followed by Club Sounds East lounge in the lobby and videos in the cinema.

Tag der Clubkultur is funded by Club Commission Berlin, Senate Department for Culture and Social Cohesion and Musicboard Berlin

event_name: NATURAL pres: SAUMET (Hybrid Set) + Ancient Yogic Wisdom Session - LIVE
lineup: Saumeth
information:
(Deutsch unten)

We are pleased to announce a new edition of our Immersive Sensory Experience "Natural", next Tuesday 08. October at the same time, 7:00 PM CET.

The results from last weeks events in the larger space has been marvellous, so we'll continue doing it in there until a big step is announced.
(Deutsch unten)

We are pleased to announce a new edition of our Immersive Sensory Experience "Natural", next Tuesday 08. October at the same time, 7:00 PM CET.

The results from last weeks events in the larger space has been marvellous, so we'll continue doing it in there until a big step is announced.

Regarding the artist, Saumet, a Berlin-based multidisciplinary artist, will perform a 120-minute hybrid set inspired by the dynamics of real life, the synergy of their recent travels, and their current soundscapes. Their live compositions are always a fresh surprise influenced by the audience."

Saumeth narrates subtly the interaction between individuals, their immediate environment and soundscapes as a full composition part of the intrinsic "real-time" synergy of expression that reflects the individual as collective understanding.

The sound design is interpreted uniquely each time, as an expression of human improvisation affected by the audience, i.e. it syntactically reads the development of social behaviours and surrounding understandings where forms and architecture are central to their connection.
Saumet creates a room for the connection of individuals, crafting an atmosphere for emotional extension and mental relaxation that open channels to meditate. Visuals invite attendees explore their minds as they immerse themselves in an illusory space of audiovisual intrinsic imagery, creating room to express their immediate thoughts and sensations through glow-in-the-dark colours.

About the artist:

Saumet has been featured by different electronic music makers and record labels, as well as performed in Buenos Aires, Montevideo, Belgrade and Berlin to name some.

He creates an environment for meditation and relaxation. You can come to explore their sound through sound design and visuals, as well as to relax yourself or even paint.

Please arrive 15 minutes before 7pm to assure your place.
7pm | 7‚Ç¨ (donation for the house) or 10‚Ç¨ incl. a drink.

Limited spots.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Deutsch:

Wir freuen uns, eine neue Ausgabe unserer Immersive Sensory Experience ‚ÄûNatural‚Äú ank√ºndigen zu k√∂nnen, die am Dienstag, den 08. Oktober zur gleichen Zeit, 19Uhr MEZ.

Die Ergebnisse der Veranstaltungen der letzten Wochen in dem gr√∂√üeren Raum waren gro√üartig, also werden wir dort weitermachen, bis ein gro√üer Schritt angek√ºndigt wird.

Saumet, ein Berliner K√ºnstler, der mit verschiedenen Medien arbeitet, wird ein 120-min√ºtiges Set spielen, das eine Mischung aus verschiedenen Stilen ist. Es ist inspiriert vom echten Leben, seinen letzten Reisen und den Kl√§ngen, die er gerade h√∂rt. Seine Live-Sets sind immer eine √úberraschung, beeinflusst vom Publikum.

Saumet erz√§hlt eine Geschichte dar√ºber, wie Menschen miteinander interagieren, ihre Umgebung und die Ger√§usche um sie herum. Das alles ist Teil der 'Real-Time'-Erfahrung des gemeinsamen Ausdrucks.

Das Sounddesign ist immer anders, je nach Publikum. Es ist wie eine menschliche Improvisation, die auf die Menschen um sie herum reagiert. Die Art und Weise, wie Menschen sich verhalten und verstehen, beeinflusst die Musik. Die Formen und Strukturen des Raums sind auch wichtig.

Saumet schafft einen Raum f√ºr Menschen, um sich zu verbinden. Er schafft eine Atmosph√§re, in der man seine Gef√ºhle sp√ºren und entspannen kann. Das hilft dir zu meditieren. Die Visuals laden dich ein, deinen Geist zu erkunden, w√§hrend du dich in der Welt der Bilder verlierst. Du kannst deine Gedanken und Gef√ºhle mit den leuchtenden Farben ausdr√ºcken.

√úber den K√ºnstler:

Saumet wurde von verschiedenen elektronischen Musikmachern und Plattenlabels vorgestellt. Er hat auch in Buenos Aires, Montevideo, Belgrad, Berlin und anderen St√§dten gespielt.

Er schafft eine Umgebung f√ºr Meditation und Entspannung. Du kannst kommen, um seinen Sound durch Sounddesign und Visuals zu erkunden, zu entspannen oder sogar zu malen.

Bitte kommt Ihr 15 Minuten vor 19 Uhr, um euren Pl√§tze zu sichern.
19 Uhr | 7‚Ç¨ (Spende f√ºr das Haus) oder 10‚Ç¨ inkl. Getr√§nk.

Begrenzte Pl√§tze.

lineup: Open Decks for Vinyl DJs
information:
VINYL ONLY! 

Jeden Dienstag ab 18:00 Uhr. Seit inzwischen mehr als 10 Jahren ist der Dienstag mit "Open Decks & Tischtennis" im Humboldthain Club eine feste Instanz f√ºr Nordberliner Bewegungsjunkies. 

Ob die Platten zum Auflegen, die Kellen f√ºrs Tischtennis oder die Ballerinas f√ºr den Floor ‚Äì jeden Dienstag k√∂nnt ihr euer Spielzeug mitbringen und vom Wochenende entschlacken. 
Ob Techno, Drum and Bass, Disco oder Mamas Schlagersammlung ‚Äì jeder Stil ist willkommen und wird vom Publikum abgefeiert. 

Daher bietet der "Open Decks Abend" vielen jungen DJs eine nach wie vor einzigartige Plattform zur Darbietung ihrer K√ºnste und zum Austausch untereinander. 

Zwei Tischtennisplatten, genug Kellen f√ºr alle, ein Kickertisch, satter Sound aus den Boxen und nicht zuletzt leckeres Bier vom Fass, tragen dazu bei, dass eine stetig wachsende Zahl an gut gelaunten Menschen den Dienstag im Humboldthain Club zu ihrer Homebase erkl√§rt hat. 

FAQ Frage: Wie l√§uft das mit dem Auflegen? 
Antwort: Zu Beginn jeder Veranstaltung liegt an der Mainbar eine Liste mit den DJ-Slots f√ºr den Abend aus. 

Jeder Slot geht eine halbe Stunde und jeder DJ darf nur einen (seinen) Namen in die Liste eintragen. 
Pro Abend gibt es 20 Slots! 
Es empfiehlt sich also, nicht all zu sp√§t zu kommen, sonst ist die Liste voll.

lineup: FOOD, FLEA MARKET, ART & MUSIC
information:
Cr√™pes & Open Decks

As an open source concept, the desire for community and a traditional French meal becomes a communal, open gathering of music, culture and cuisine.

Join us on the banks of the Spree - the lifeline of Berlin and the place of pilgrimage for club culture enthusiasts from all over the world - the Aeden becomes a meeting place twice a month for vinyl DJs, designers, artists, creatives and music-loving people.

We would like to invite you to fill your belly with delicious Cr√™pes (whether savory or sweet is up to you!), accompanied by a cold beer. Get ready to enjoy music from vinyl diggers and exciting, hand-made products from local designers, surrounded by art in a paradisical garden setting.

Whether it's after work, before a birthday party or just to spontaneously enjoy a nice evening with your besties, everyone will find something to enjoy at Cr√™pes & Open Decks.

Want to become a part of it?
We are looking for motivated co-creators, whether vinyl DJs, local designers or talented artists.

Get in touch with us via DM on Instagram @crepes_opendecks

Join us and become part of the community.
Together we are stronger; sharing still means caring!

Entrance Fee: 6 EUR
Make sure to bring cash at the door & stores.
Card payment at the bar.

lineup: MissVergn√ºgen, Zschaber
information:
"People are strange..." ‚Äì umso sch√∂ner, wenn es dann noch die passenden Songs dazu gibt. Und noch besser, wenn das Vergn√ºgen verspricht ‚Äì oder genauer: Zschaber und Resident DJ MissVergn√ºgen! Strange Songs for Strange People ist die legend√§re Partyreihe, mit der das Vergn√ºgen im Eschschloraque seinen Lauf nahm und sich bis heute mit immer ausgefeilteren Sets zeigt: Die Strange Songs bildeten die Anf√§nge ihrer Mittwochabende, die l√§ngst zum festen Ritual geworden sind. 

MissVergn√ºgen gestaltet seit den 2000er Jahren den musikalischen Underground mit ihren eklektischen Sets und ausgesuchten Gast-DJs mit. Eine ziemlich einzigartige Energie geht von den Turntables aus, wenn musikalischer Rausch zum Vergn√ºgen wird!

Dj Zschaber, sonst ein Verfechter des gepflegten Kontinuums, wird an diesem Abend f√ºr die spezielle Couch-Situation Platten mitbringen, die es mangels Mixbarkeit noch nie in eins seiner DJ Sets geschafft haben.
Obskura, Absurdita und Exotica mit einem dennoch wohlwollenden Blick auf Groove und Tanzbarkeit.

information:
EVERY FUCKING THURSDAY, UNITY AT KITKAT CLUB

UNITY is a vibrant kinky community of free spirits who seek to connect with their souls and bodies in a respectful, sexy, and playful manner. We have created a space where you can bring your fantasies to life and anticipate high-quality lineups, ranging from uptempo trance/neotrance to berlin uptempo techno, providing a diverse musical experience for all. We want to get behind normal DJ Gigs. Our focus on high quality berlin techno concerts and uptempo trance live Acts. 

You are a Live Band or Live Act or you are playing hybrid dj gigs? Send us an email to unity.events.berlin@gmail.com

Rules
- know the Party you go to - UNITY ‚Äì and the Artists of the night.
- no strict dresscode, but: ‚Äûdress for kitkat club‚Äú ‚Äì be creative!
- by purchasing a ticket, you consent to our team taking photos at the event for promotional purposes. If you prefer not to be photographed, please inform our photographer.
- UNITY tries to be a safe space for everyone. Treat others with respect. All individuals are welcome, regardless of sexual orientation, origin, or religion. Any unwanted touching, offensive language, or disrespectful behavior will result in exclusion from the event.
- if you feel uncomfortable, don't hesitate to contact our awareness team or any staff member on duty (bouncer, bar staff, etc.). We will assist you promptly!
- a no-photo policy is in place for all guests. If you want a photo get in touch with our photographer. He or she will capture images for our social media channels.

event_name: Lunchbox Candy - Sugar Free - A Sober Experience
lineup: ADAM MUNNINGS¬†, ketia , KIM SWIM¬†, Anita Drink
information:
It's all the flavour with none of the additives. Lunchbox Candy - Sugar Free is a chance to get high on life as we present a jam-packed evening filled with energetic house music, intimate connection, deranged performances, sexual healing, transformative workshops and oh dancing, yes there will be dancing!

We're creating a sober experience for not only those who lead a sober lifestyle or the sober curious but to all of our community for a chance to bathe in the wonders of Lunchbox Candy without consuming alcohol or any other substances. An opportunity to connect with yourself and others, naturally. 

To kick off the evening on the Candy Flip floor the amazing Phoenix Chase-Meares will facilitate a movement workshop 'How To Access The Non Fearful Body' followed by Alvin Collantes lifting our spirits higher with 'A Dose Of Pleasure'. Participation is optional but highly recommended but please remember spaces are limited. 

On The Box Floor we will have music all night long with Djs Adam Munnings, Ketia, Kim Swim and Anita Drink to keep you moving and grooving. A fire lineup of inspiring hosts / performers curated by Nancy Nutter will be sure to blow your mind and keep you entertained, gooped and gagged. Expect the unexpected, after all it's Lunchbox Candy. 

Our Love Room will be open for cuties who love to cruise hosted by Lesbo Pro (House Of Steel). It's a space for all bodies, genders and sexual orientations. Let's celebrate sexuality without the chems. Sip a mocktail, snack on some fresh fruit and trust yourself and the process cause all we're consuming is a damn good time. 

Join us October 10th at Aeden Berlin for Lunchbox Candy - Sugar Free, a sober experience open to all. Doors open at 7:30pm.

lineup: Gigi Masin (live), Marco Shuttle¬†, Temple Rat¬†(live), Simone Merli b2b Born in 1986
information:
CONCENTRIC RECORDS SHOWCASE II
Zenner, Berlin | October 10, 2024 | 19:00 - 00:00

Concentric Records returns to Berlin for the second edition of its live showcase at Zenner, continuing its exploration of immersive, genre-defying music. Staying true to the label‚Äôs vision, the event unites artists who navigate the spaces between sound, identity, and collective experience.

At the forefront is Gigi Masin, the Venetian composer and ambient music pioneer. With a career stretching back to the 1980s, Masin‚Äôs deeply emotional and improvisational compositions are characterized by serene atmospheres and delicate soundscapes. His ability to transport listeners into a world of calm reflection has made him a beloved figure in experimental music circles.

Also performing live is Temple Rat, a rising electronic artist from China who merges the ancient with the contemporary. Known for integrating traditional Chinese instruments like the guqin with modern ambient and electronic elements, her music evokes spiritual and mystical themes. Temple Rat‚Äôs performances are immersive, offering listeners a transcendent journey that blends ancient sounds with ethereal modernity.

On the decks, Marco Shuttle will deliver one of his signature deep and atmospheric sets. Shuttle is known for creating richly textured, hypnotic soundscapes that oscillate between dark, industrial and more experimental tones.

Opening the night will be Concentric Records‚Äô own Simone Merli and Born In 1986, who will deliver experimental ambient DJ sets. As label founders, their sets reflect the eclectic and boundary-pushing ethos of Concentric Records, blending field recordings, deconstructed rhythms, and soundscapes that defy categorization.

Join us for a night of sound exploration, where artists blur the lines between genres, creating an unforgettable collective sonic experience.

lineup: Conic Rose (JazzLab/D) *live*
information:
Conic Rose: Genres als Schwarm

Hypnotische Stadtnachtfahrten und lichtdurchflutete Sehnsuchtsorte. Eine Reise ins Niemandsland zwischen Traum und Wirklichkeit, Hoffnung und Ern√ºchterung, Alltag und Flucht. Die Musik von Conic Rose l√§sst sich nur schwer auf eine g√§ngige Formel bringen. Je nach Blickwinkel kann man sie als Indie-Pop, Jazz, Ambient oder Electronica bezeichnen, wobei Indie-Jazz vielleicht eher zutrifft.

Wer ihr Deb√ºtalbum ‚ÄúHeller Tag‚Äú (2023) noch nicht kennt, hat etwas verpasst und sollte es unbedingt nachholen. Das Album ist jedenfalls mehr als die Summe aufgez√§hlter Stile: Es schw√§rmt in die Genres hinein, sammelt, f√ºgt zusammen, l√§sst zerfallen und beginnt immer wieder von vorne, ohne sich irgendwo zu verlieren. Die Klangkaskaden der Band klingen im Ergebnis fokussiert, dabei sind viele der St√ºcke nur einmal aus der Improvisation heraus eingespielt und produziert worden. F√ºr Trompeter Konstantin D√∂ben und Pianist/Keyboarder Johannes Arzberger sowie Gitarrist Bertram Burkert, Bassistin Franziska Aller und Drummer Silvan Strauss ist barrierefreie Offenheit die Formel, die alles zusammenh√§lt.

Ausgehend vom heiseren Ton der Trompete, eingebettet in schwebende Klangteppiche aus elektrischer und akustischer Gitarre, Keyboards, Bass und einem Schlagzeug, das Einfl√ºsse von J.S. Bach, Krautrock, Thom Yorke oder Bonobo erkennen l√§sst, entwickelt sich auf ‚ÄúHeller Tag‚Äú eine Musik, die ebenso ziellos wie unbeirrbar ihren Weg findet. Das Rezept liegt in der perfekten Mischung aus intuitivem Kalk√ºl und kalkulierter Intuition. Die Lust am eigenen Klang ist bei Conic Rose in jedem Moment sp√ºrbar. Sie √ºbersetzt sich in Bilder, deren eindringliche Beil√§ufigkeit sich auf der inneren Leinwand des zuh√∂renden Betrachters festsetzt und weiterlebt.

Conic Rose, das ist junger, urbaner und unheimlich offener Jazz, der mit Experimentierfreude und anmutigen Klanglandschaften das Publikum vom ersten Moment an in seinen Bann zieht. So war es beim letzten Konzert im Gretchen und so wird es wieder sein. Unbedingt hingehen.

F√ºr diese Veranstaltung bieten wir erm√§√üigte Tickets an, um auch Menschen mit kleinerem Portmonee Zugang zu Kultur zu erm√∂glichen. Diese Kontingente sind limitiert und nur bei TixforGigs verf√ºgbar. Wir vertrauen auf Eure Selbsteinsch√§tzung: Wenn ihr k√∂nnt, bucht Standard-Tickets und √ºberlasst die erm√§√üigten Kontingente denjenigen, die gerade sehr sparen m√ºssen.

Pr√§sentiert von untoldency

Photo: Mitch Stoehring

______________________________________________


Trying to place Conic Rose‚Äôs music into a standard formula is almost impossible. Depending on your perspective, you could describe it as indie pop, jazz, ambient, electronica, or as a soundtrack evoking its own images. It is all of these things, and yet much more than just the sum of the listed styles. If you haven't heard their debut album 'Heller Tag' (2023), you're missing out and should definitely go and get it.

Trumpet player and bandleader Konstantin DoÃàben describes this phenomenon as both a blessing and a curse. But that is pure understatement, because it is precisely the unmistakable sound of his husky trumpet that gives the album its special aura, floating on the tranquil soundscapes of electric and acoustic guitars, keyboards, bass ‚Äî and stoic drums, which bring together the influences of J.S. Bach, Krautrock, Thom Yorke or Bonobo into a sound aesthetic that generates associations with Jon Hassell, Nils-Petter Molvaer or Toshinori Kondo‚Äôs unforgettable band IMA. ‚ÄûConic Rose‚Äù does not need a catchword, because the music describes itself.

Rounding out the band is Bertram Burkert on guitar, bass and synthesizers, Franziska Aller on bass, Johannes Arzberger on keyboard/piano and Silvan Strauss on drums.

As focused as the sound cascades of Conic Rose may be, many of them came about through improvisation: they were recorded, enriched with the other instruments, and finally produced. Nothing was prepared. The band surrendered to inner moods that they could only make audible by playing them. The process was a perfect mixture of intuitive calculation and calculated intuition. The magic formula for DoÃàben and his crew is unhampered openness in all directions.

________

For this event we offer discounted tickets to give people with less money still access to culture. These quotas are limited and only available at TixforGigs. We trust in your self-assessment: If you can, please book standard tickets and leave the reduced tickets to those who have to save money at the moment.
